🌵 Streams in the Desert - April 21 🌞

"🙌 And being absolutely certain that whatever promise He is bound by, He is able to make good 🙌"
(Romans 4:20)

👉 The Bible tells us Abraham could look at his own old body (which was as good as dead) without feeling discouraged. Why? Because he wasn't looking at himself - he was looking at Almighty God!

Abraham didn't doubt God's promise. He stood strong under the weight of God's blessings. Instead of getting weaker, his faith grew stronger when things looked impossible. He praised God, being completely sure that God who made the promise was not just able, but more than able (the Greek words mean God has unlimited power and endless resources) to do what He said.

Our God has no limits to what He can do. The only limits are the ones we put on Him. Our prayers are too small. Our dreams are too small. Our faith is too small. God wants to lift us up to think bigger and expect more from Him. Will we disappoint Him by thinking small?

There's no limit to what we can ask from our great God El-Shaddai (the All-Sufficient One)! There's only one measure for how much He will bless us: "according to the power that works in us."

--A. B. Simpson

🧗 "Climb up to God's treasure house of blessings using His promises like a ladder. Use God's promises like keys to unlock the door to all His grace and favor." 🗝️

🌟 May God increase your faith to believe Him for great things today! 🌟
